meanings.definition: A person or thing that destroys or kills a large proportion of something.
meanings.sent1: The decimator in the story was a giant monster that destroyed entire cities.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire acted as a decimator, wiping out the entire forest.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy was a little decimator, chewing up all the shoes in the house.
meanings.sent4: The virus spread like a decimator, taking down one person after another.
meanings.sent5: The tornado was a ruthless decimator, leaving nothing but destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: A device used to reduce the strength or amplitude of a signal.
meanings.sent1: The audio engineer adjusted the decimator to lower the volume of the music.
meanings.sent2: The decimator helped clean up the static in the radio transmission.
meanings.sent3: The decimator was like a magic wand, making the loud noises disappear.
meanings.sent4: The decimator functioned as a shield, protecting the equipment from overpowering signals.
meanings.sent5: The decimator worked silently, taming the audio waves to a manageable level.
